Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (partly worn) below; part of a lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: slip worn; short vertical strokes around rim above band of short outlined tongues, alternately blank and black.
Curator's comments: Tongue patterns around the rim on Chian chalices occur in the Wild Goat Style. However, such early vases do not have interior decoration as seen on this sherd. Perhaps this sherd marks a transition from the Wild Goat Style to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0384) (phase 2)
